page.title: 15EPPIE CALLUM'S TREE
page.content: At the west of Macrosty Park, over the bridge, an ancient oak spreads its mighty limbs under the shelter of which stands a cottage which bears the same name. Its age has benn calculated at about 500 years,and its girth measures 6meters. Legend has it that the acorn from which this tree grew was planted in a teapot by Eppie Callum, but this must be a legend since old residents of Crieff can still remember Eppie Callum who kept the pub under the tree. Tradition has it that {ROB ROY} once hid in its branches and that {BONNIE {PRINCE CHARLIE} once rallied his highland followers on his way south to claim his throne in England. It was damaged by a lightening bolt in the great thunderstorm of 12th, August 1884 but it still stands, keeping its story to itself.
